Third part (third Java program):

Implementing this in C:

long number = min_val;

long ans = -1;

long value =0;

int mask =2;

while (1) {

    // convert mask to binary string, then substring(1).

    // first, get binary string of mask.

    char bin_str[32]; // enough for mask up to 2^31.

    int len_bin = 0;

    int temp = mask;

    do {

        bin_str[len_bin++] = (temp %2) + '0';

        temp /=2;

    } while (temp >0);

    // reverse the string to get the correct binary.

    char reversed_bin[32];

    for (int i=0; i < len_bin; i++) {

        reversed_bin[i] = bin_str[len_bin -1 -i];

    }

    reversed_bin[len_bin] = '\0';

    // substring(1) → skip first character.

    char s[32];

    if (len_bin <2) {

        // mask is 2 → binary is "10", substring(1) is "0".

        // but if mask is 1 → binary is "1", substring(1) is "".

        // but mask starts at 2.

        strcpy(s, reversed_bin+1);

    } else {

        strncpy(s, reversed_bin+1, len_bin-1);

        s[len_bin-1] = '\0';

    }

    // count zeros.

    int zeros =0;

    for (int i=0; i < strlen(s); i++) {

        if (s[i] == '0') zeros++;

    }

    int ones = strlen(s) - zeros;

    if (zeros == ones) {

        // replace 0 with 4, 1 with7.

        char new_str[strlen(s)+1];

        for (int i=0; i < strlen(s); i++) {

            if (s[i] == '0') new_str[i] = '4';

            else new_str[i] = '7';

        }

        new_str[strlen(s)] = '\0';

        // convert to long.

        value = atol(new_str);

        if (value >= number) {

            ans = value;

            break;

        }

    }

    mask++;

}

printf("%ld\n", ans);

Putting all together.

Now, the C program structure:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main() {
    // Read first program's inputs
    int h, w, n, sr, sc;
    char s[100], t[100];
    scanf("%d %d %d %d %d %s %s", &h, &w, &n, &sr, &sc, s, t);

    // Process first program's logic
    int usafe = 1, dsafe = h;
    int end = 0;
    for (int i = n-1; i >= 0; i--) {
        char c = s[i];
        if (c == 'U') {
            usafe++;
        } else if (c == 'D') {
            dsafe--;
        }
        if (usafe > dsafe) {
            end = 1;
            break;
        }
        if (i > 0) {
            char tc = t[i-1];
            if (tc == 'U') {
                dsafe = (dsafe + 1 > h) ? h : dsafe + 1;
            } else if (tc == 'D') {
                usafe = (usafe - 1 < 1) ? 1 : usafe - 1;
            }
        }
    }

    int lsafe = 1, rsafe = w;
    for (int i = n-1; i >= 0; i--) {
        char c = s[i];
        if (c == 'L') {
            lsafe++;
        } else if (c == 'R') {
            rsafe--;
        }
        if (lsafe > rsafe) {
            end = 1;
            break;
        }
        if (i > 0) {
            char tc = t[i-1];
            if (tc == 'L') {
                rsafe = (rsafe + 1 > w) ? w : rsafe + 1;
            } else if (tc == 'R') {
                lsafe = (lsafe - 1 < 1) ? 1 : lsafe - 1;
            }
        }
    }

    char result[4];
    if (sr >= usafe && sr <= dsafe && sc >= lsafe && sc <= rsafe && !end) {
        strcpy(result, "YES");
    } else {
        strcpy(result, "NO");
    }

    // Process second program's logic
    int len = strlen(result);
    char a_str[len+1];
    strcpy(a_str, result);
    int a1 = 0;
    for (int i = 1; i < len; i++) {
        if (a_str[i] == a_str[i-1]) {
            if (a_str[i] == '1') a_str[i] = '0';
            else a_str[i] = '1';
            a1++;
        }
    }

    char b_str[len+1];
    strcpy(b_str, result);
    int a2 = 0;
    for (int i = len-1; i > 0; i--) {
        if (b_str[i] == b_str[i-1]) {
            if (b_str[i-1] == '1') b_str[i-1] = '0';
            else b_str[i-1] = '1';
            a2++;
        }
    }
    int min_val = (a1 < a2) ? a1 : a2;

    // Process third program's logic
    long number = min_val;
    long ans = -1;
    int mask = 2;
    while (1) {
        // Convert mask to binary string
        char bin_str[32];
        int len_bin = 0;
        int temp = mask;
        do {
            bin_str[len_bin++] = (temp % 2) + '0';
            temp /= 2;
        } while (temp > 0);
        // Reverse the string
        char reversed_bin[32];
        for (int i = 0; i < len_bin; i++) {
            reversed_bin[i] = bin_str[len_bin - 1 - i];
        }
        reversed_bin[len_bin] = '\0';
        // Take substring starting at index 1
        char s_part[32];
        if (len_bin < 2) {
            s_part[0] = '\0';
        } else {
            strncpy(s_part, reversed_bin + 1, len_bin - 1);
            s_part[len_bin - 1] = '\0';
        }
        // Count zeros
        int zeros = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < strlen(s_part); i++) {
            if (s_part[i] == '0') zeros++;
        }
        if (zeros == (strlen(s_part) - zeros)) {
            // Replace 0 with 4, 1 with 7
            char new_str[strlen(s_part)+1];
            for (int i = 0; i < strlen(s_part); i++) {
                if (s_part[i] == '0') new_str[i] = '4';
                else new_str[i] = '7';
            }
            new_str[strlen(s_part)] = '\0';
            long value = atol(new_str);
            if (value >= number) {
                ans = value;
                break;
            }
        }
        mask++;
    }

    printf("%ld\n", ans);
    return 0;
}
